comments.body: I personally think it might be a bit too specific to assert the exact contents of the error message; asserting it contains key words may be more flexible. But I'm OK with it. Worst case is we get some spurious test failures later.

comments.body:
I agree this way the tests are more fragile, but at least we know the whole message still looks good when someone changes the code in the future.
I would leave this as it is now.

comments.body:
Agree with Sean. Tests like this are very brittle and don't add much value. All you'd achieve is someone changing both places to adjust the error message, which is just annoying.

Checking that the message contains the config key you're expecting seems enough to me.
